only $100 in patient "aid" offered annually- hardly making any impact on patients
poor communication from home office
too many layers of management and staff- i often wondered what people actually did
few opportunities for substantial growth

pros: Good Vacation and PTO. They also have a pension program.  It is amazing to be working for a good cause too.
cons: High turnover makes it difficult to really be successful.  It is difficult to move up in the organization, and there isn't a ton of staff development provided.

job_title: Campaign Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The mission of this organization is great! Higher ups are generally passionate about what they are doing which is awesome.
cons: The mission of this organization is great - a worthy cause for sure! That said, they treat part time employees quite poorly. With little room for advancement you become dissolutioned with the process quickly.

pros: The staff are a mission-driven and friendly group. It's a very social place to work and fun within a few years after college.
cons: There is no career path or plan for staff development. The leadership in the organization is very weak, which likely relates to the lack of staff training and development. There is a large disconnect between the national office and chapter offices.

pros: For the most part amazing and kind co-workers. Possibility of working with some great companies/professionals and with kind and loving families. Hit the ground running attitude necessary.
cons: No work-life balance. Lowest pay in the nonprofit sector. Low bonuses. Glass ceiling. Disturbing senior leadership with no work experience to back up their title (one bad seed).

pros: Great progress being made with investments of research dollars. Chapter EDs do a remarkable job with little support or appreciation from national leadership.
cons: The business is poorly run at the highest levels.  Technology is lagging, talent is not developed, retained or promoted.  National leadership is a clique who know little about field staff & volunteers.

job_title: Vice President Donor Development in New York, NY
pros: great mission wish they continued to fight for it and help patients with less focus on money outside of donor development
cons: poor leadership they have had opportunities to ensure that positive people bring energy and life to the org but have failed to use those people wisely. instead they have obstructors and negative people who make it difficult for people who really want to make a difference

pros: Team In Training was a great experience because you meet people going through the same journey. I recommend participating in their events.
cons: When you sign up for the marathon, get ready to market and raise funds for your participation. If you do not meet the fundraising goal they will not let you particiapte in the marathon.

job_title: Campaign Manager in White Plains, NY
pros: Nice to do good and help provide funding for cancer research.
cons: Little to no training, employees are generally very green in order to pay extremely low salaries, creating an environment of young kids with no mentors.  Long hours.

pros: The staff was very friendly and incredibly helpful with teaching you new skills and showing you how to do your work.  They were very open to new project ideas and allowing you to sit in on meetings.
cons: I worked during a not so busy season for my campaign, so at times there were not a lot of tasks for me to do.

pros: Great work environment!  Everyone is very friendly and wants to help out one another.  I appreciate the work enviroment- it is almost all female and everyone is there for the right reason.  To work this job you have to agree with the mission, because that is what makes this position worthwhile.  Although the pay is low, the person reward is great.  This job is fantastic and anyone who takes it will not regret their decision!
cons: Low pay for the location.

review_title: Great start to a career in Nonprofit sector
pros: Volunteers and staff are all great to work with.  You truly feel like you are making a difference toward the fight against blood related cancers.
cons: Lack of training at the Chapter level, and little oversite of Senior Management.  Because of a lack of resrouces, often times you are working long and hard hours.

pros: It was beyond amazing meeting survivors, family members, and athletes who were passionate about fundraising and/or training. Good benefits and pay for entry-level.
cons: Ridiculous hours, disrespectful and highly judgmental work environment, expectations that cannot be met, lots of blame thrown around. On the job training was way worse and different than what they had told me to expect (when I asked about job training in the last interview.) They completely threw out the giant training handbook that people before me had used.

pros: This is quite an interesting place to work, you're not always sitting at a desk and the tasks are not too repetitive. It's nice to do things that are helping save lives.
cons: Sad because it is obvious that a lot of people you work with are not in it for the cure, but for money. Patient Access is one of the best sections!

pros: Great leadership and mentorship. I felt like I was able to have an impact even as an intern. Did not get the full employee experience, however I enjoyed my time there.
cons: Sometimes there wasn't enough work for the interns to do. Although I know interns are temporary, it would have been nice to feel more included on the team.

review_title: Will make you think twice about a non-profit career
pros: Working with participants who are mission focused
cons: There are so many events at all times that you get burnt out quickly. The politics of upper-management is absurd and delays every single project you are working on to the point where it is a huge detriment to your work flow. Room for growth at lower levels, but quickly fizzles out. Too many women who think they know best.

review_title: Great work life balance, great management support, Great feedback
pros: Lots of feedback on performance and suggestions, great leadership from my direct managers.  Excellent work life balance!
cons: Political Manuvering can be tricky,  and I did not think it existed at this company, but it does!

review_title: Not a bad place to work
pros: Great mission, great staff team, fun events, decent work-life balance, overall I enjoy being a part of the organization.
cons: National management seems in disarray, and are missing a clear plan of action to staff.

pros: The mission of the organization is very important and the work they are doing is important work. People generally have a positive outlook about the work they do.
cons: Management can sometimes lack transparency. Large scale changes are made often without explanation. It is hard to tell often how genuine the management is about what they say to employees.

pros: Nearly 80% of funds raised go to mission
cons: LLS is able to provide so much to mission because they are entirely understaffed and underpay their employees.  Employees are expected to do the equivalent of multiple jobs and management has refused to fill positions to save money, but then expects (and communicates this expectation to staff) that they need to "make it happen" with the limited staff they have, and the extra hours need to be put in.

pros: The organization is extremely passionate about the mission, puts customer service at the top of priorities, and employees are given a ton of responsibility. There is great opportunity to change roles if you are looking for something new within the organization. They value employees and promote when revenue goals allow it.
cons: Most people I've encountered have burnt out after a couple years. Constantly looking to grow, so it's never enough. Management often restructures. As campaigns have grown, work/life balance has gone down.

pros: Amazing mission and very impressive research focus. local management was great and there was a decent amount of transparency. Work life balance was good. Though hours were long and there were often a lot of events management didn't focus on the clock and allowed you to be flexible with time.
cons: Professional development and on boarding could use a lot of work and standardization. Focus on revenue and revenue related jobs seems unbalanced with mission or program focused work.

review_title: Strong mission, run like a business
pros: Resources; field staff; branding; volunteers; runs like a business; strong eye on bottom line
cons: Like many national non profits there's a strong disconnect between the field and the national office.  Decisions are made as directives to chapters vs. a collaborative effort.  There's obvious dysfunction at the ELT level, including bullying, which has been reported to HR a number of times but clearly ignored for way too long.

review_title: A good mission, but that does not equal good business.
pros: Flexibility with time off, autonomy.
cons: Salary at 40% less than comparable non-profits. Very few opportunities, and no method to promoting, etc. The donor dollars are spent horribly, as I see absolutely no business management sense.

pros: LLS is funding research to cure cancer. The CEO does care about the community served by the organization. There are so many opportunities to get involved and make a difference in the blood cancer space.
cons: LLS is slow to change and make hard decisions that impact the "LLS Brand."

pros: Fun office atmosphere, casual, inspirational and rewarding. Managed very well on a national basis.
cons: Not managed well on a local basis, lot of turnover in staff leading to shortcomings in local chapter revenue.

review_title: Efforts and contributions are appreciated in a respectful, collegial atmosphere.
job_title: Shared Services in White Plains, NY
pros:
Professional yet friendly atmosphere; opportunities to grow with support from management; 
encouraged to provide feedback to the highest levels on ways to improve our mission or business operations; very meaningful purpose in additional to career growth.
cons: None to speak of - you make your own destiny here.

pros: Funds researchers. Provides employment for people.
cons: Wasteful spending on meetings, travel, hotels, meals, meetings and tchotchkes. Multiple layers of administration. Waste money on keeping former employees as "consultants". Inadequately funded programs for patients. Programs only last a couple of weeks/months, just so organization can say that they do something for patients. They spend more money to keep machine going than to serve people with blood cancers.

pros: I have never known an organization to do more for cures than the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.  The passion and dedication of the staff are tremendous as are the volunteers from event participants to Board members to patients and committee members.
cons: The organization continues to evolve, and with changes in the philanthropic landscape, one needs to do more and raise more with less. Stragegy happens at the National level and is implemented at the local level.

review_title: Make a difference. Great mission. Low pay. Lots of Work.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Working for a greater cause; working for something you're proud of and that you're truly benefiting society. 
Flexible with some work from home days.  
Great coworkers
cons:
A lot of work for little pay.  
Lack of job security.

job_title: Special Events Assistant in Clearwater, FL
pros: The overall mission of the organization is very good and they do help a lot of people in need. They are one of the few charities left that has co-pay assistance programs for patients and the percentage that they put back into the research is very high.
cons: They over work their employees and sometimes set unrealistic goals.

pros: Very strong mission, Everyone who works for the organization is very passionate about the mission of the leukemia and lymphoma society.
cons: Each campaign works against each other instead of as a team.  Very unprofessional atmosphere in the office environment.

pros: Like-minded hard workers passionately dedicated to the same mission, Wonderful volunteers, Great benefits including 401K matching
cons: Low salary, Incompetent leadership at local chapter, My department (TNT) was the had the biggest budget but received the least amount of attention or recognition, Not great work/life balance with Team In Training

review_title: great place to volunteer and work
job_title: Campaign Assistant in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: open and friendly work environment, flexible time off, help you to grow and willing to help you move up in your career.  I started as a volunteer and was later hired full-time.
cons: Did not always set clear expectations and job descriptions or who should report to who

review_title: Great mission, but not many opportunities for growth"
job_title: Campaign Manager in San Jose, CA
pros: Fun coworkers, a great mission,  and working with an inspiring group of volunteers and honorees on a daily basis.
cons: Not many opportunities to advance your career, work schedules often conflicted with work/life balance (working nights and weekends), and a high-turnover rate.

pros: LLS is doing some amazing work, and I love the work that I get to do! Teaching kids (and teachers) about blood cancer is really fun!
cons: Not enough benefits come with the job. Yes, we get health insurance and quite a few vacation days, but with the salary we receive, there should be some other kind of....incentive to do a good job I guess.

job_title: Light the Night Director in San Jose, CA
pros: Amazing mission, incredible people, wonderful senior leadership. I am inspired daily! We are truly curing cancer and having fun doing it!!!
cons: IT systems are going through a major renovation and that can be fruStrating at times. It is hard to become so attached to patients and lose them to cancer.

pros: I could technically list this as work experience
cons:
Poor Management
High Turnover
Deceiving About Position
Low Pay
Lots of Out of Pocket Expenses

pros: Mission, CEO, national office always there to support. They’ve really improved employee trainings and support over the past two years. I feel passionate, knowledgeable, and supported in my role. I also have advanced pretty quickly! Love LLS.
cons: Direct management. Smaller offices around the country seem to be ignored.

review_title: I worked at the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society for over 10 years.
pros: It's a noble mission -- and interactions with patients can be rewarding.
cons: Unfortunately, the mission of the organization has become secondary to a leadership that is self-serving and arrogant.  Staff are treated as disposable and volunteers treated dismissively. The Research program is focused on turning the organization into a drug company, Patient Services has been emaciated and the Advocacy program serves as a shill for drug companies.   It's an intimidating and callous culture.

job_title: Student Intern in San Mateo, CA
pros: Really nice people to work with, people care bout their jobs and are professional
cons:
Hard to say because there are so many different chapters as opposed to the organization as a whole plus I was not there too long due to the position being temporary.
Which I guess a con would be it is hard to work for them because a lot of their jobs are part time and temporary

pros: During the interview process, I was led to believe this was an incredible place to work and the people who work there loved their job. I also believed the fundraising went to help those that needed it.
cons: It was a really toxic environment. I had fellow coworkers explain everyone is looking for a new job, the turnover rate was extremely high, there were mouse traps in the office and no one could explain where the fundraising dollars went.

pros: Strong fundraising strategy. Strong brand and campaigns. Dynamic CEO with a clear vision. Great people to work with and an amazing mission. Dollars are well spent and progress is being made toward cures/treatments.
cons: Vision is clear, which is good, but difficult at times when it means the cancellation of local programs and services for patients.

review_title: Built on mission, run like a business
pros: Working at LLS allows you to utilize so many skills including fundraising and sales, relationship building, management, and strategic planning all while working with a collaborative team to fight cancer
cons: Not a con but LLS is run like a business and we are held accountable to our goals.

pros: Work life balance is great when its not a campaign event week. Friendships. Casual workplace.
cons: Management. Outdated Ideals. Lack of assistance for the community. Not the same place I began working for...its morphed into something that cares more about profits than our families and patients.

review_title: Chaotic and unstable environment diminish worthwhile organization
pros:
Great cause--who doesn't want to cure cancer?
Fantastic and supportive volunteers and supporters
Hard working staff
cons:
Lots of restructuring from national down to local areas has made for a chaotic environment
Reactive rather than proactive management at top and middle levels
Lots of staff turnover in the past 5 years
Fundraising emphasized over service delivery

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rye Brook, NY
pros: LLS is funding amazing research to finding cures for blood cancers that could be applied to all cancers as well.
cons: Despite its great mission, the organization is more corporate than what a non-profit should be, so staff can fill boxed into their positions and may not feel like their work matters.

pros: Their mission is excellent and moving and their expenses are kept to a reasonable minimum.
cons: Extremely poor and inequitable treatment for performers. Favoritism and popularity are more highly prized by mid and upper management, rather than work ethic or results.

pros: Working with patients, friends and family teams, work/life balance is fantastic, sense of community, seeing the advances in research
cons: Office politics - everyone is out to get someone else, job stability is no longer clear cut, room for growth is basically non existent, salary is fixed and no room for raises due to consistent budget cuts

pros: Great company with good pay, excellent benefits and great opportunity outside of the organization. Skills gained and networking capabilities are exceptional.
cons: Flexibility is limited and ability to work from home is not good. Not a lot of room for growth because the office is small and would may require relocation to take on more opportunities. High expectations are great, but you will work very hard.

pros: welcoming atmosphere, great people to work with, management and other employees were more than willing to teach me
cons: Mainly works autonomously or with one other person so I did not get t0o much of the office-job experience

pros: Great co-workers and good work-life balance. Really appreciate the mission and the volunteers who help make it a reality.
cons: There is an uncertain future and you can feel it in work-place morale. Not as much upward mobility as one might like.

pros: I like to work in field with people and I want to improve my skill and want to communicate with people
cons: Always do best and prove our ability and I will try my best for it job and I can prove my self if I got chance

review_title: My time working there was very rewarding, yet very busy supporting the many life-changing campaigns.
pros: Most of the staff has a personal passion and commitment to the betterment of the organization. Donors are not seen as donors, they are volunteers, and soon become friends.
cons: There was minimal time to improve processes because time is so limited as it to support multiple campaigns.

pros: the mission is incredible and everyone is so passionate and dedicated; great to be a part of something bigger than yourself
cons: salary not as generous as for-profit -- but most people don't go into non-profit for the money. donor dollars are being put to research and programs

job_title: Campaign Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great mission.  Work with co-workers and volunteers that are passionate about the mission.
cons: Leadership at the local level is disorganized.   Frequently work nights and weekends.      No human resources  at local chapter so it  is difficult if there is a problem with another employee or your boss.

review_title: LLS is a wonderful place to gain experience and help fight blood cancer.
job_title: Light the Night Campaign Support in Dallas, TX
pros: Great people, work-life balance, fantastic staff
cons: Pay is a little lower since it is a non-profit. They have good benefits and offer lots of vacation time. Upward movement not always a possibility.

pros: Fantastic mission, meaningful work for patients. it was terrific to be part of something where you could see a tangible, important impact.
cons: Revenue declines have created a difficult environment.  There is a lack of clear direction while the organization continues to evolve.  This will likely become a smaller organization that can hopefully continue to provide meaningful support for patients.

review_title: Great cause, but restructuring management and lay offs have left employees stressed and over worked.
job_title: Campaign Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The volunteers and employees are all dedicated wonderful people. Being involved in the organization is a rewarding and inspiring everyday.
cons: The office is short staffed and over worked. The office location is directly in front of LAX making commuting from any where a complete nightmare.

pros: This is a great company with a great mission! Their employees are some of the best people I have ever worked with. Everyone is so passionate about what they do.
cons: Not a lot of room for growth as it is such a small company division wise.

pros: Mission driven: all employees are passionate about the cause, whether they have been affected by blood cancer or not.  Very team oriented - employees help one another out!
cons: Weekend hours and some long week nights, depending what campaign you are on. However, work-life balance is emphasized greatly.  You work long hours one day, but you get to go home early the next, etc.

review_title: Great Cause but no respect in the office
pros: great cause wonderful Volunteer Staff
cons: terrible culture no respect micromanagement

pros:
The mission of this organization keeps you coming to work everyday. While you may not have a lavish salary, you know that the dollars raised are being spent wisely. 

Additionally, the PTO policy is great with a significant amount of time off, as well as paid holidays.
cons: Difficult to receive promotions and raises. Long hours and weekend work.

pros: Great mission and volunteers, fundraising money is going to important research saving lives today
cons: Poor upper management, low morale, expectations were not achievable, flattery of management was rewarded over hard work and dedication. Extremely high turnover and burnout

pros: It has, on its face, a wonderful mission and does provide funding for academic researchers
cons: It is a very corporate environment - but most problematic are the ties to the drug industry - which really drives its advocacy agenda.   Pimping for big pharma.

review_title: Worst place to work for IT
pros: There are no Pros, it's a career killer
cons: Management is inept and continually make wrongheaded decisions that hurt the organization and place a tremendous amount of stress on the staff. They drive out anyone with any talent or fresh ideas. Management is very sneaky and underhanded. They don't foster any respect or trust with the staff and they don't value original ideas. Worst place I've ever worked...

review_title: Waiting to see what comes next...
pros: Great mission with amazing volunteers and donors. Everyone wants a cure for cancer so a no-brainer as far as supporting a meaningful charity.
cons: Lots of changes recently and a little uneasiness with the future.  Looking forward to what comes next after the changes.

pros:
- Helpful and driven staff
- Getting to meet volunteers and survivors, reaffirming the importance of the mission
- Working towards an incredible cause
- High ambition goals
- Professionalism is super important
- Active learning about non-profits
cons:
- Low salary (which is expected at a non-profit)
- Very fast-paced with very high expectations - definitely an adjustment if you can't handle it.

pros: Great cause, events have support from the national level and training as well.  Work hard, play hard!  Flexible schedule especially after the conclusion of a campaign.
cons: Sometimes the national office is a little out of touch with the local market opportunities.  District Managers help educate them.

job_title: Senior Campaogn Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great people work and volunteer here.
cons: No one at the top seems to have a clear direction or strategy on how to move the chapter and its employees forward. Not much career growth opportunity.

pros: Amazing work environment. Great benefits and time off.  The people at LLS  are uplifting, motivating, and inspiring. Management is so helpful and I am so happy to work here.
cons: I can not find any cons at this time. The management is great and the people are amazing. Great work environment.

pros: Staff is willing to help you learn everything there is to know, so that if a higher (full-time) position comes up you are ready! Staff was very friendly and fun environment.
cons: There are no cons for this company, great experience and would recommend it for anyone who has the heart to help those in need!

pros: Great office team, great PTO benefits, great mission
cons: False advertising in terms of opportunities for professional development and promotion. Promotion ultimately decided by National Board of Directors, rather than office executives who know the candidates, and is based primarily on overall chapter performance, rather than individual. Makes it difficult to get promoted despite individual workload.

pros: Great mission! Unlike many non-profits, they really do spend funds raised on research to find cures for blood cancers. They do a lot to help patients as well.
cons: There can be high turnover in personnel, which is typical with non-profit agencies though. Everyone has to pick up the slack where needed and some people don't like that.

pros: I really liked the people and the company had a great mission
cons: Too much work for too few people, and the upper management caused a lot of stress through poor communication. Not to mention many of them were just incompetent.

pros:
Work directly with each department
End of the internship project based on your interests
Hands-on learning
You have to potential to make a real impact on the company
Potential to be hired after successful completion of internship
cons: Depending on your interests, you may or may not like working in certain departments, but that is an individual choice

pros: There is super good communication skills and freedom to work in a comfortable environment that brings out all the best in you.
cons: You have to be supper active, creative, fearless and goal oriented.

pros: The pay is adequate with the experience level I have, and the chapter I work in has really great employees. Coming to work everyday isn't a chore.
cons: Al though there are guidelines for my job, I do a little bit of everything. It isn't exactly a con.

pros: Everyone was very friendly! The work is for a great cause, and it's exciting to help organize events that will be fundraising hundreds of thousands of dollars.
cons: Have to be extremely detail-oriented and ready to do a lot of work to make sure the event turns out how you want it to.

pros: Pay was average.  Literally all I can say here.
cons: Office culture was sneaky and gossipy. Very little employees actually cared about the needs of the patients - only cared about fundraising, which was heavily tied to/influenced by pharma and truly never benefited the patients directly. While I was there they cut thousands of patients' monthly stipend (upwards of $10,000) with no notice.  Office was 98% white and snobby. Horrible work/life balance.

review_title: Dynamic, high-energy, collegial organization that produces high impact therapies and cures for people with blood cancers
job_title: Anonymous Employee in White Plains, NY
pros: Meaningful work, professional atmosphere, real sense of purpose
cons: working with some people who aren't as dedicated to the mission and excellence.
Leadership doesn't reflect rest of staff (most staff are women, leadership was almost exclusively men) and leadership roles are turned over frequently

job_title: Senior Campaign Director in New York, NY
pros: LLS is a mission-centered organization that attracts talented, dedicated individuals who will keep you motivated each day you're in the workplace
cons: Hours can be long, with many weekend and evening obligations

pros: The mission is a really good one.
cons: There is a lot of behind the scenes decisions that takes place with upper management - Directors and the corporate office - and it makes for a very unstable work life.  I would not work here.  A lot of toxic gossip, you'll be told that the job you're doing is great and the next day everything is terrible.  Really not worth it.

pros: You can really learn anything you have ever wanted to about business, healthcare, and research significance.  A job you do because you want to expose yourself to alot of different facets of a business.
cons: High expectations on all staff with a lack of recognition of the reality of those expectations.

pros: Patient support and overall mission solid.
cons: Awful management, unfair HR practices, gas-lighting and political plays at top and choosing "favorites".  Extremely stressful working conditions, most staff in chapter working 3-4 jobs and long hours w/low pay.

pros: The office had a friendly environment, everyone on my team worked well together towards a very worthy goal. Paid about what was expected for a job like this.
cons: There was a high turnover rate for the Outreach Assistants. It was only a part-time, temporary job so this was to be expected.

review_title: 3 years experience in sales line nd 1 year in finance..
job_title: Finance and Marketing in Bawāna, Delhi
pros: they may be good in the sector and future opportunities in the sector
cons: like customer handling and makes the party to convience ...and hard to find out party in the sector

pros: Incredible amounts of opportunity for professional growth. Wonderful mission with hard working and driven co-workers.
cons: Tendency to give responsibilities to  employees before they are ready and push already full work loads.  High burnout rate.

review_title: The position entails you to wear many hats.
pros: You are able to walk away each day knowing you made a difference in the lives of those affected by blood cancer.
cons: It's hard to move up within the company and the pay is low for the amount of work you put in.

pros: Great team working to fulfill a strong mission, with achievable goals and measurable outcomes. Feel good about what you do, and meet amazing patients and volunteers.
cons: Small staff, pay not always commiserate with industry, semi-high turnover rate. sometimes long hours - significant amount of night/weekend work.

job_title: Campaign Manager in Rye Brook, NY
pros:
-great volunteers
-they compensate you well for a non-profit
-great mission
-the money we raise actually goes to the cause, and more than 80%. Low overhead cost.
cons:
-bad work-life balance
